title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Zechariah chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Zechariah Chapter 9.

questions.question: Which land is mentioned first in the burden of the word of the LORD in Zechariah 9:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Hadrach
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:1 begins by mentioning 'The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach.'

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9:3, what did Tyrus build herself?
questions.correctAnswer: A strong hold
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:3 states that 'Tyrus did build herself a strong hold.'

questions.question: What will happen to Tyrus according to Zechariah 9:4?
options: She shall be devoured with fire
questions.correctAnswer: She shall be devoured with fire
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:4 says 'she shall be devoured with fire.'

questions.question: Which city’s king is said to perish in Zechariah 9:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Gaza
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:5 mentions 'the king shall perish from Gaza.'

questions.question: Who will dwell in Ashdod according to Zechariah 9:6?
questions.correctAnswer: A bastard
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:6 says, 'And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod.'

questions.question: What will happen to the pride of the Philistines as stated in Zechariah 9:6?
questions.correctAnswer: It will be cut off
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:6 states, 'I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.'

questions.question: What will the one who remains be for God, according to Zechariah 9:7?
questions.correctAnswer: As a governor in Judah
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:7 says the one who remains 'shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah.'

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 9:8 says that oppressors will continue to pass through God's house.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:8 states 'no oppressor shall pass through them any more.'

questions.question: In Zechariah 9:9, what is the King riding upon?
questions.correctAnswer: An ass and a colt
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:9 says the King is 'riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.'

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9:10, what will be cut off from Ephraim and Jerusalem?
questions.correctAnswer: Chariot and horse
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 states 'I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem.'

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 9:10 promises that the King will speak peace unto the heathen.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 states 'he shall speak peace unto the heathen.'

questions.question: In Zechariah 9:11, what has been sent forth by the blood of the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Prisoners
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:11 says 'by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Zechariah 9:12: 'Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of _______.'
questions.correctAnswer: hope
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:12 calls prisoners 'prisoners of hope.'

questions.question: What will the LORD do with the arrow according to Zechariah 9:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Go forth as the lightning
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:14 says 'his arrow shall go forth as the lightning.'

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 9:17 describes corn as making the young men cheerful.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:17 states 'corn shall make the young men cheerful.'

medium.title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Zechariah Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Zechariah 9, what biblical truth would you share about God's protection and deliverance?
options: God will encamp around His people and no oppressor will pass through them
God will allow trials without any intervention
God will punish the faithful for their trust
God will hide from His people in times of trouble
questions.correctAnswer: God will encamp around His people and no oppressor will pass through them
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:8 explains that God will encamp about His house because of the army, ensuring no oppressor passes through. This is supported by Zechariah 9:11-12, which speaks of prisoners being released and hope restored, and Zechariah 9:16 where God saves His people like a flock.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 teach us about humility and recognizing the true nature of the Messiah?
options: The King comes lowly, riding upon an ass and a colt
The King arrives in great military power and chariots
The King demands riches and glory
The King remains hidden and unknown
questions.correctAnswer: The King comes lowly, riding upon an ass and a colt
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:9 emphasizes the humility of the Messiah, who comes just and having salvation, lowly and riding on an ass and the colt of an ass. This contrasts with worldly expectations of power, as further explained in Zechariah 9:10 where chariots and horses are cut off.

questions.question: A believer seeks guidance on how to maintain hope during imprisonment or hardship. What encouragement does Zechariah 9 offer?
options: Turn to the stronghold, prisoners of hope, for God declares He will render double
Give up hope because deliverance will not come
Rely solely on human strength to escape
questions.correctAnswer: Turn to the stronghold, prisoners of hope, for God declares He will render double
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:12 calls believers 'prisoners of hope' to turn to the stronghold and promises God will render double. This is supported by Zechariah 9:11 where prisoners are released by the blood of the covenant and by verse 16 where God saves His people.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 instruct us about God’s justice and the downfall of the proud and wicked?
options: God will smite the power of Tyrus and devour her with fire
God will bless the proud and exalt their riches
God ignores the wicked and allows them to prosper
God defends the wicked against their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: God will smite the power of Tyrus and devour her with fire
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:4 states the Lord will cast out Tyrus, smite her power in the sea, and she shall be devoured with fire. Verses 5-7 further describe the judgment on Philistine cities and cutting off their pride, demonstrating God's justice.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with pride and power. Based on Zechariah 9, what biblical advice would you give?
options: True power comes from humility and submission to God
Pride leads to lasting dominion and honor
Power is to be sought through wealth and military strength
Ignore God and trust only in yourself
questions.correctAnswer: True power comes from humility and submission to God
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:9 shows the King comes lowly, not by pride or military might. Verse 10 explains cutting off chariots and bows and speaking peace. Verses 13-15 describe God’s mighty defense of His people, emphasizing reliance on Him rather than worldly strength.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 teach about God’s faithfulness in fulfilling His covenant promises?
options: God sent forth prisoners by the blood of the covenant
God forgets His promises when people fail
God’s promises are conditional on human perfection
questions.correctAnswer: God sent forth prisoners by the blood of the covenant
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:11 states God has sent forth prisoners by the blood of the covenant, showing faithfulness to His promises. This is supported by verse 12’s encouragement to prisoners of hope and verse 16’s assurance of God saving His people.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 9, the Messiah’s kingdom will extend from sea to sea and from the river to the ends of the earth.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 states the Messiah’s dominion will be from sea to sea and from the river to the ends of the earth, indicating the vastness of His kingdom and peace.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 9 describes the Messiah as a warrior who uses chariots and horses to conquer nations.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 states the chariot, horse, and battle bow will be cut off, indicating the Messiah does not conquer by war but by peace and righteousness.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 encourage believers to respond to God’s goodness and beauty?
options: By rejoicing and being cheerful with corn and new wine
questions.correctAnswer: By rejoicing and being cheerful with corn and new wine
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:17 celebrates God’s goodness and beauty, saying corn will make young men cheerful and new wine the maids, encouraging thankful joy and contentment.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with bitterness towards others. Based on Zechariah 9, what biblical truth about God’s justice and mercy could you share?
options: God will cut off pride and purge abominations, but those who remain will serve Him
God ignores sin and allows all to prosper
God favors the proud and powerful
God’s mercy only applies to a select few
questions.correctAnswer: God will cut off pride and purge abominations, but those who remain will serve Him
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:6-7 describes God’s judgment on pride and sin, but also that those who remain will be for God and become rulers, showing both justice and mercy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zechariah 9:16 says, 'And the LORD their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a _______, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.'
questions.correctAnswer: crown
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:16 compares God's people to stones of a crown, symbolizing honor and prominence in His land.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 illustrate the importance of trusting God rather than relying on human wisdom or wealth?
options: Tyrus’ wealth and wisdom will not save her from God’s judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Tyrus’ wealth and wisdom will not save her from God’s judgment
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:2-4 shows that despite Tyrus’ wisdom and great wealth, God will cast her out and smite her power, illustrating the futility of trusting in human resources over God.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 encourage believers in their role as witnesses and participants in God’s plan?
options: By raising up sons of Zion against enemies and making them like the sword of a mighty man
By relying on human diplomacy alone
questions.correctAnswer: By raising up sons of Zion against enemies and making them like the sword of a mighty man
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:13 describes God raising up the sons of Zion against their foes, symbolizing active participation in God's deliverance and testimony.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to seek peace through worldly power rather than God. What counsel does Zechariah 9 provide?
options: True peace comes when chariots, horses, and bows are cut off and the King speaks peace
Peace is gained through military strength
Peace is impossible without political alliances
questions.correctAnswer: True peace comes when chariots, horses, and bows are cut off and the King speaks peace
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 teaches that God will cut off chariots, horses, and bows, and the King will speak peace to the nations, encouraging trust in God’s peace rather than worldly force.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9 encourage believers to respond to God’s defense and provision in times of trial?
options: By rejoicing and making noise like those filled with wine
questions.correctAnswer: By rejoicing and making noise like those filled with wine
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:15 depicts the LORD defending His people who will devour and subdue enemies and rejoice noisily like those filled with wine, teaching joy and confidence in God’s provision.

hard.title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Zechariah Chapter 9.

questions.question: Which city is described as having built herself a stronghold and heaped up silver and fine gold in Zechariah 9?
questions.correctAnswer: Tyrus
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:3 states that Tyrus built herself a stronghold and heaped up silver as the dust and fine gold as the mire of the streets.

questions.question: What is the significance of the king coming 'lowly, and riding upon an ass' in Zechariah 9:9?
options: It signifies a humble and peaceful king, fulfilling Messianic prophecy
It symbolizes military conquest with great power
It indicates the king’s royal wealth and splendor
It reflects a pagan ritual common in the ancient Near East
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies a humble and peaceful king, fulfilling Messianic prophecy
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:9 describes the king as just and having salvation, lowly and riding upon an ass, which foreshadows the New Testament fulfillment in Jesus’ triumphal entry, emphasizing humility and peace.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9, what will happen to the chariot and horse from Ephraim and Jerusalem?
options: They will be cut off to promote peace
They will be multiplied to strengthen the army
They will be preserved as holy artifacts
They will be given as gifts to foreign nations
questions.correctAnswer: They will be cut off to promote peace
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 says the chariot from Ephraim and the horse from Jerusalem will be cut off, indicating the end of war and the establishment of peace.

questions.question: Which ancient Philistine city is described as having its king perish and becoming uninhabited?
questions.correctAnswer: Gaza
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:5 mentions that the king shall perish from Gaza and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited, highlighting the downfall of these Philistine cities.

questions.question: In Zechariah 9, who is described as dwelling in Ashdod, and what is to happen to the pride of the Philistines?
options: A bastard shall dwell, and their pride will be cut off
A king shall dwell, and their pride will be exalted
A prophet shall dwell, and their pride will be increased
A priest shall dwell, and their pride will be preserved
questions.correctAnswer: A bastard shall dwell, and their pride will be cut off
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:6 states a bastard will dwell in Ashdod and the pride of the Philistines will be cut off, symbolizing judgment over the Philistines.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 9 describes the LORD as defending His people and enabling them to subdue their enemies with sling stones.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:15 explicitly states that the LORD of hosts shall defend His people and they shall devour and subdue with sling stones.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'prisoners of hope' in Zechariah 9:12 refer to within the context of Israel's restoration?
questions.correctAnswer: Exiles awaiting deliverance and restoration
questions.explanation: The term 'prisoners of hope' in Zechariah 9:12 metaphorically refers to the Israelites held captive or exiled but hopeful for God’s restoration and double blessing.

questions.question: Which imagery in Zechariah 9:14 symbolizes divine intervention and power?
options: Arrow going forth as lightning and trumpet sound with whirlwinds
A lion roaring among the nations
A river flowing from the temple
A burning bush in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: Arrow going forth as lightning and trumpet sound with whirlwinds
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:14 uses the arrow going forth as lightning and the trumpet blown with whirlwinds of the south to symbolize the LORD’s powerful and sudden intervention.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zechariah 9:17 states, 'For how great is his ________, and how great is his beauty!'
questions.correctAnswer: goodness
questions.explanation: The verse Zechariah 9:17 praises the LORD’s great goodness and beauty, emphasizing divine benevolence.

questions.question: What does the raising up of 'thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece' in Zechariah 9:13 symbolize?
options: The conflict between Israel and Hellenistic powers
An internal struggle between priests and kings
questions.correctAnswer: The conflict between Israel and Hellenistic powers
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:13 alludes to opposition between Israel (Zion) and Greek (Hellenistic) forces, reflecting historical tensions after Alexander the Great’s conquests.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9:11 connect the 'blood of thy covenant' with the deliverance of prisoners?
options: It signifies God's faithfulness to His covenant in setting prisoners free
It predicts a political treaty with surrounding nations
It refers to a sacrificial ritual for cleansing
It warns about the consequences of covenant breaking
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies God's faithfulness to His covenant in setting prisoners free
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:11 associates the blood of the covenant with God’s act of releasing prisoners, symbolizing covenantal redemption and deliverance.

questions.question: Which phrase in Zechariah 9:8 indicates God's protective presence around His house?
options: 'For now have I seen with mine eyes'
questions.correctAnswer: 'I will encamp about mine house'
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:8 uses the phrase 'I will encamp about mine house' to depict God’s protective guarding of His people against enemies.

questions.question: What is the literary significance of the mention of 'corn' and 'new wine' in Zechariah 9:17?
options: Symbols of joy, blessing, and prosperity
questions.correctAnswer: Symbols of joy, blessing, and prosperity
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:17 uses corn and new wine as imagery representing abundance, joy, and God's blessings on the people.

questions.question: Which cities are mentioned as bordering the land of Hadrach according to Zechariah 9:1-2?
questions.correctAnswer: Damascus, Hamath, Tyrus, and Zidon
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:1-2 lists Damascus, Hamath, Tyrus, and Zidon as cities in the region around Hadrach.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9:16 describe the people of God on the day of salvation?
options: As the flock of his people and stones of a crown lifted up as an ensign
As wandering sheep without a shepherd
questions.correctAnswer: As the flock of his people and stones of a crown lifted up as an ensign
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:16 portrays God’s people as a flock saved and as precious stones forming a crown, symbolizing honor and divine favor.

theological.title: Zechariah Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Zechariah Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9:9, how is the coming King described?
options: Just, having salvation, lowly, riding upon an ass and a colt
Mighty warrior with a sword and chariot
King of kings seated on a fiery throne
A conquering king riding a horse
questions.correctAnswer: Just, having salvation, lowly, riding upon an ass and a colt
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:9 prophesies a King who is just and brings salvation, humble and riding on a donkey and its colt. This is consistent with Matthew 21:5 and John 12:15, which show Jesus fulfilling this messianic prophecy and emphasizing humility and salvation (Isaiah 42:1, Psalm 72:1-2).

questions.question: What will be cut off from Ephraim and Jerusalem, according to Zechariah 9:10?
options: The chariot from Ephraim and the horse from Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The chariot from Ephraim and the horse from Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 declares that military implements like chariots and horses will be cut off, symbolizing peace and the end of war. This aligns with Isaiah 2:4 and Micah 4:3 where God promises peace and disarmament among nations, showing God's sovereign rule bringing salvation and peace.

questions.question: What attitude should the daughter of Zion and Jerusalem have toward the coming King, as instructed in Zechariah 9:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice greatly and shout
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:9 commands rejoicing and shouting in anticipation of the just and saving King. This joy echoes the messianic hope found in Psalm 98:4-9 and Luke 2:10-11, affirming the eschatological joy in God's salvation.

questions.question: In Zechariah 9:11, what is the means by which the prisoners are sent forth?
options: By the blood of thy covenant
By the strength of the army
By the destruction of their captors
questions.correctAnswer: By the blood of thy covenant
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:11 emphasizes deliverance through the blood of the covenant, pointing to the sacrificial atonement of Christ (Hebrews 9:15, Ephesians 1:7), highlighting God's redemptive plan to free captives and save His people.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'strong hold' mentioned in Zechariah 9:12?
options: It symbolizes a place of refuge and hope for the prisoners
It is a physical city to be destroyed
It refers to the temple altar
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes a place of refuge and hope for the prisoners
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:12 calls prisoners of hope to turn to the strong hold, symbolizing God's protection and salvation. This imagery parallels Psalm 18:2 and Isaiah 25:4 where God is depicted as a refuge and fortress for His people.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9:14, what accompanies the LORD when He is seen over His people?
options: His arrow goes forth as lightning and He blows the trumpet with whirlwinds of the south
He descends with fire and brimstone
He appears with a cloud of darkness
questions.correctAnswer: His arrow goes forth as lightning and He blows the trumpet with whirlwinds of the south
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:14 describes the LORD's powerful and sudden intervention with lightning-like arrows and trumpet blasts, symbolizing divine judgment and deliverance. This imagery resonates with Joel 2:1 and Exodus 19:16, showing God's majestic presence.

questions.question: What will happen to the king of Gaza and the inhabitants of Ashkelon, according to Zechariah 9:5?
options: The king shall perish and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited
They will be exalted among nations
They will form an alliance with Israel
They will be blessed and prosper
questions.correctAnswer: The king shall perish and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:5 prophesies judgment on Gaza and Ashkelon, with the king perishing and Ashkelon becoming desolate. This judgment theme is consistent with Ezekiel 25:15-17 and Jeremiah 47:5-7 where these cities face divine punishment for their opposition to God's people.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 9:7 say about those who remain after God's judgment on the Philistines?
options: They shall be for our God and as a governor in Judah
They will become enemies of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be for our God and as a governor in Judah
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:7 reveals that the remnant after judgment will belong to God and serve as leaders in Judah, showing God's grace and restoration. This reflects the biblical principle of a faithful remnant (Isaiah 10:20-22, Romans 11:5).

questions.question: What does Zechariah 9:8 promise regarding oppressors?
options: No oppressor shall pass through them any more
questions.correctAnswer: No oppressor shall pass through them any more
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:8 promises divine protection against oppression, affirming God's role as defender of His people. This is consistent with Exodus 14:14, Psalm 34:17, and Isaiah 54:17 where God protects and vindicates the oppressed.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 9:15 describe the LORD of hosts' defense of His people?
options: They shall devour and subdue with sling stones and be filled like bowls
He will send an army of angels to fight
He will destroy them with fire from heaven
He will hide them in caves
questions.correctAnswer: They shall devour and subdue with sling stones and be filled like bowls
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:15 portrays the LORD empowering His people to defeat enemies with humble means like sling stones, symbolizing God's strength in weakness (1 Samuel 17:40-51, Psalm 18:34). The imagery of being filled like bowls suggests abundance and joy in victory.

questions.question: What is the scope of the dominion of the King described in Zechariah 9:10?
options: From sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: From sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:10 depicts the messianic reign as universal, extending over all the earth, consistent with Psalm 72:8 and Daniel 7:14, which describe the eternal kingdom of the Messiah covering all nations.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9:13, against whom are the sons of Zion raised up?
questions.correctAnswer: Against the sons of Greece
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:13 mentions the sons of Zion being raised against the sons of Greece, symbolizing God's empowerment of His people against foreign oppression. This aligns with biblical history where Israel faced Grecian dominance (Daniel 8:20-22) and God promised deliverance.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 9:16 say about the people on that day?
options: They shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon His land
They will be scattered among the nations
They will be silent and fearful
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon His land
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:16 describes the people as precious and exalted, like stones in a crown, symbolizing honor and divine favor, similar to Exodus 28:17-20 and Revelation 21:19-21 where believers are portrayed as precious stones in God's kingdom.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 9:17 say will make the young men and maids cheerful?
questions.correctAnswer: Corn and new wine
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:17 states that corn and new wine will bring cheerfulness, symbolizing God's provision and blessing. This theme of abundant provision and joy is reflected in Psalm 104:14-15 and John 15:11.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 9:3 say about Tyrus' wealth?
options: Sheaped up silver as the dust and fine gold as the mire of the streets
Had little wealth and was poor
Relied only on trade with Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Sheaped up silver as the dust and fine gold as the mire of the streets
questions.explanation: Zechariah 9:3 describes Tyrus as having immense wealth, piling silver and gold abundantly, illustrating human pride and idolatry condemned in Isaiah 23:7-8 and Ezekiel 28:4, highlighting the futility of trusting in riches over God.
